newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Omega bonus issue approved.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Omega bonus issue approved.

text.p: Stockbroking group Omega Holdings Bhd said its proposed bonus issue has been approved by the Securities Commisssion, but on revised term.

Omega will now make a bonus issue of up to 152.74 million shares on the basis of one new share for each existing share held to be capitalised entirely out of the company's retained account, it said in a statement.
The company had originally proposed a three-for-two bonus issue of up to 229.11 million shares to be capitalised out of its share premium and retained profits account.

Omega said the Securities Commission approval was subject to subsidiary companies of Omega making dividend payments to a level sufficient for the group to meet the minimum reserve retention of 16.3 million ringgit.
It said the company has decided to submit an appeal to the Securities Commission.
